item.title: Towards Spatial Supersensing in Video
item.description: Speaker Shusheng Yang is currently a second-year Ph.D. student at NYU Courant, advised by Prof. Saining Xie. His research lies at the intersection of computer vision and multimodal learning, with a specific focus on visual representation learning, spatial intelligence, life-long video understanding, and unified model/world modeling. Please checkout Shushengâ€™s latest work here: https://scholar.google.com/citations?user=v6dmW5cntoMC&hl=en. Abstract While MLLMs have advanced the field of video understanding, we demonstrate that they still treat video as sparse frames, underrepresent spatial structure, and rely heavily on textual recall.
